title: Aluminum Eases from 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK fell to $2,850 per tonne from a three-year high of $2,915 on November 1st, reflecting a broad pullback in base metals due to soft manufacturing PMIs in the US and China. Despite the dip, lingering supply concerns have kept prices 12% higher year-to-date.

title: Aluminium price dips slightly to USD 2,878.55/t amid mixed market signals
summary: Aluminum futures were quoted at around USD 2,878.55 per ton on November 12, 2025, marking a slight daily drop of 0.15%. The market remains volatile with mixed signals, but prices are still near recent highs.

title: Forget Rare Earths: Aluminum Is the Metal of the Moment
summary: Aluminum is trading near a three-year high, close to US$2,900 per metric ton, driven by supply constraints in China and recovering global demand. Investment positioning has turned strongly bullish, with analysts forecasting potential supply deficits in 2026.

title: Aluminum Prices Surge Amid U.S. Government Reopening Hopes
summary: Aluminum prices on the London Metal Exchange surged 1.7% to $2,895 per ton, fueled by optimism over a potential U.S. government reopening. This positive sentiment has contributed to recent price strength in the aluminum market.

title: Commodity Update – November 2025
summary: Aluminum prices opened at $2.18 and have gained 14% this year, trading near a three-year high due to China's smelter capacity struggles amid rising demand. China, producing about 60% of the world's aluminum, is reaching output capacity, pushing expansion abroad and raising concerns about tighter supply or greater reliance on foreign production. The Aluminum Association urges unified USMCA enforcement to prevent tariff circumvention and ensure fair trade.

title: Alcoa says high US aluminum prices offset Trump tariff costs
summary: Alcoa reported that US tariffs on Canadian aluminum increased costs by $69 million compared to the previous quarter, but higher domestic aluminum prices have more than offset these tariff costs. The company expects tariff-related costs to rise further by $50 million in the current quarter, reflecting declining inventory and imports, while shipments from Canada to the US are returning to normal.

title: Forget Rare Earths Aluminum Is the Metal of the Moment
summary: Aluminum prices have surged to their highest since May 2022 due to supply constraints in China and renewed optimism for global demand after a tentative US-China trade truce. China has imposed production limits tightening supply, while demand rebounds in construction, automotive, and consumer goods sectors. The market expects higher shipment volumes and notes aluminum demand could grow 40% by 2030 driven by infrastructure and energy efficiency trends.

title: Premiums for aluminum in U.S. reach record highs
summary: Aluminum premiums in the U.S. have reached record highs amid strong demand and supply challenges. This reflects broader market dynamics including trade policies and economic factors impacting aluminum pricing and availability in North America.

title: Linktour's 'Can-to-Car' Aluminum Tech Sets New Standard
summary: Linktour has developed a proprietary WQAL Registered technology that uses post-consumer aluminum to minimize waste and energy consumption, significantly reducing the carbon footprint in vehicle manufacturing. Their all-aluminum monocoque body reduces vehicle weight by 45% compared to steel, enhancing performance and energy efficiency while promoting sustainability in EV production.

title: Inert Anode Aluminium Technology: Revolutionary Breakthrough
summary: Rio Tinto has successfully implemented a 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at its Alma smelter in Quebec, eliminating direct CO₂ emissions from aluminium production. This technology is a key part of Rio Tinto's decarbonisation strategy and is being scaled with a demonstration plant under construction at the Arvida smelter, promising a transformative impact on sustainable aluminium production.

title: ELYSIS Hits Milestone: First Inert Anode Aluminum Cell
summary: ELYSIS has started up a 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at Rio Tinto's Alma smelter, marking the first commercial-scale use of this technology that produces aluminium without direct carbon emissions. This breakthrough supports large-scale low-carbon aluminium production and is central to Rio Tinto's long-term decarbonization plans, with a demonstration plant underway at Arvida.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball and Unilever are using aluminium produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology, which employs inert anode technology to eliminate greenhouse gas emissions. This collaboration combines low-carbon primary aluminium with high recycled content, representing a significant advancement in sustainable aluminium packaging and supply chain innovation.

title: Manufacturer unveils innovative product that could transform future brake calipers
summary: Brembo has launched brake calipers made from 100% recycled aluminum, reducing lifecycle carbon emissions by 70%. After five years of R&D, this innovation demonstrates that high-performance automotive components can be produced sustainably without compromising quality, marking a significant step in the industry's sustainability efforts.

title: Revolutionizing Industries: The Rising Impact of Lightweight Metal Tubing
summary: Lightweight aluminum-based metal tubing is driving industrial transformation by offering high strength-to-weight ratios that improve efficiency and sustainability in automotive, aerospace, and construction sectors. Innovations in low-carbon manufacturing and closed-loop recycling are enhancing environmental performance, supporting global sustainability goals.

title: Major step forward for emissions-free aluminium smelting
summary: ELYSIS is advancing aluminium production by replacing carbon anodes with inert materials that generate oxygen instead of greenhouse gases. This technology aims to revolutionize the industry by enabling emissions-free smelting, contributing significantly to global decarbonization efforts.

title: Turkey billet prices increased in the second half of October, affecting imports and domestic supplies
summary: In Turkey, billet prices rose in late October, impacting both domestic supplies and imports from Russia. However, Russian companies face limited price increases due to weak demand outside Turkey, and Turkish steel producers have struggled to raise rebar prices, limiting further cost increases for scrap and semi-finished products.

title: NDRC: China's steel prices to rally in November
summary: China's steel prices are expected to rebound in November amid cautious optimism among market participants. Recent reports indicate a rangebound rebar market with some softening, but overall bullish sentiment is supported by macroeconomic signals and capacity adjustments.

title: American rebar producers have raised prices by $60/t
summary: American rebar producers have increased prices by $60 per ton, reflecting ongoing cost pressures and market dynamics. This price adjustment is part of broader trends in steel production and consumption observed globally.

title: Proposal to amend publication deadline for Germany, Italy steel scrap price assessments
summary: Fastmarkets proposed changing the publication deadline for Germany and Italy domestic steel scrap price assessments from the second Friday to the final Friday of each month. This amendment aims to ensure all key market participants have finalized monthly prices before assessments are published.

title: Steel & Tube: Procurement Update Nov 2025
summary: Steel & Tube released a procurement update for November 2025, providing insights into current cost drivers and market conditions as the year ends. The update highlights ongoing challenges and trends affecting steel procurement costs.

title: IEEFA: Oman a Frontrunner in the Green Steel Transition
source: Association for Iron & Steel Technology - AIST
summary: A report from the Institute for Energy Economics and Financial Analysis (IEEFA) highlights Oman as a global leader in the green iron and steel industry, emphasizing its progress in sustainable steel production.

title: U. S. Steel to Build DRI Plant on Big River Steel Works Campus
source: Association for Iron & Steel Technology - AIST
summary: United States Steel Corporation confirmed plans to build a direct reduced iron (DRI) plant on the Big River Steel Works campus in Osceola, Arkansas, as part of a broader $11 billion capital investment program including new hot strip mill construction and blast furnace relining.

title: Indian steel industry stumbles in September 2025 but outlook remains strong
summary: India's crude steel production fell 4% month-on-month to 13.56 million mt in September 2025 due to weak demand and extended monsoon impacts, with pig iron production also down 6%. Despite this, the outlook remains positive with expected growth driven by GST cuts and festive demand.

title: Vale gearing up to meet Indian demand as China steel output stagnates, CEO says
summary: Vale's CEO stated that the company is preparing to meet rising iron ore demand from India, which is expected to double its steel production capacity to around 300 million tons in the next five to seven years. Meanwhile, China's steel production has stabilized near 1 billion metric tons and may decline slightly.

title: China's steel mills deepen output cuts over Oct-Nov as demand, margins weaken
summary: Chinese steel mills have continued to reduce production in late October and early November due to declining construction demand and weakening profit margins, contributing to a slowdown in steel output.

title: China October crude steel output slides on weather-led restrictions, lower margins
summary: China's crude steel output in October 2025 fell 2% from the previous month and declined 12.1% year-on-year, impacted by weather-related production restrictions and lower profit margins.

title: Commodity Update – November 2025: Steel demand looks modest for 2026
summary: The World Steel Association projects global steel demand to remain flat in 2025 compared to 2024, with a modest rebound expected in 2026. Growth drivers include a slowdown in China's demand decline, strong growth in India and Vietnam, and recovery in Europe, although risks like elevated costs and trade tensions persist.

title: IEEFA: Oman a Frontrunner in the Green Steel Transition
summary: A report from the Institute for Energy Economics and Financial Analysis (IEEFA) indicates that Oman is positioned to become a global leader in the green iron and steel industry. The country is making significant progress in the transition toward sustainable steel production.

title: U.S. Steel to Build DRI Plant on Big River Steel Works Campus
summary: United States Steel Corporation confirmed plans to construct a direct reduced iron (DRI) plant on the Big River Steel Works campus in Osceola, Arkansas. This investment represents a significant step toward cleaner steel production methods.

title: Steel Dynamics Inc. Promotes Matt Bell to President of OmniSource
summary: Steel Dynamics Inc. has promoted Matt Bell to president of OmniSource, the company's metals recycling platform. This leadership change reflects the industry's growing emphasis on recycling and sustainable steel production.

title: Primetals Technologies, Deutsche Bank Extend ESG Initiative and Set Gender Diversity Goal
summary: Primetals Technologies and Deutsche Bank have extended their agreement linking financial trading to sustainability, social responsibility, and gender diversity goals. This partnership demonstrates the steel industry's commitment to environmental and social governance standards.

title: Commodity Update – November 2025
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange reached a new high driven by the US-China trade deal at the end of October. Despite a current surplus, supply disruptions at key mines are intensifying, signaling a potential shortage in 2026. Copper prices have surged over 25% this year, helped by a weak US dollar and falling interest rates.

title: Copper Prices, Charts, Analysis & Forecast
summary: Copper prices showed slight fluctuations with the LMEselect Copper 3 Month price at around $10,859/mt on November 14, 2025. Downstream procurement remains weak, but spot discounts for SHFE copper are unlikely to widen as delivery dates approach, keeping transactions near parity.

title: Copper price hovers near $11,000 as test of record high beckons
summary: Copper prices hovered just below $11,000 a ton, close to last year's record high, amid supply concerns following incidents at major mines including the suspension of Freeport-McMoRan’s Grasberg pit in Indonesia. The metal has rallied about 25% this year, with supply challenges becoming a key investor concern.

title: Copper Price Outlook 2025: Supply Demand & Price Forecast
summary: The copper price forecast for late 2025 projects a trading range of $9,000 to $10,500 per metric tonne, with demand expected to outstrip supply by about 400,000 tonnes. Persistent supply constraints and growing demand from infrastructure, renewable energy, and agricultural modernization are driving elevated prices and volatility.

title: Copper retreats on weak China data, US caution
summary: Copper prices retreated after a four-session winning streak due to weak economic data from China raising demand concerns, alongside cautious investor sentiment in the US. This pullback reflects ongoing sensitivity of copper prices to global economic indicators.

title: Grasberg Mine Suspension Creates Major Copper Production Crisis
summary: The Grasberg mine suspension has caused a significant disruption in copper production, with Freeport McMoRan reporting a 13.2% decline in Q3 2025 output compared to Q3 2024. The suspension could reduce 2025 copper production by approximately 262,000 metric tons, a 35% decrease from original forecasts, driving copper prices to 15-month highs of $10,485 per metric ton due to tightened supply.

title: Border States Commodity Update — November 2025
summary: Copper supply disruptions are intensifying following incidents at key mines, signaling a potential shortage in 2026 despite a current surplus. Copper prices have surged over 25% this year, influenced by a weak U.S. dollar and falling interest rates, with the International Copper Study Group forecasting a 150,000 metric ton production drop in 2026.

title: DPM Metals Reports Record Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: DPM Metals reported strong copper production of 7.8 million pounds in Q3 2025, a 6% increase over Q3 2024, driven by higher ore volumes and copper grades. However, copper production for the first nine months of 2025 was 8% lower than 2024 due to lower grades and recoveries, consistent with the mine plan.

title: American Pacific Announces Sale of Palmer Copper-Zinc VMS Project to Vizsla Copper
summary: American Pacific Mining sold its Palmer Copper-Zinc VMS Project to Vizsla Copper for $15 million in equity plus up to $15 million in milestone payments. The project is seen as a critical metals opportunity in Alaska, with Vizsla Copper planning to advance exploration and development in 2026.

title: Vizsla Copper to buy Palmer VMS project
summary: Vizsla Copper announced the acquisition of the Palmer VMS project, a significant copper-zinc deposit in Alaska. The acquisition is expected to enhance Vizsla's portfolio of critical mineral assets and support year-round exploration activities.

title: Investor targets copper production boost
summary: The Kansanshi S3 expansion project, commissioned in the second half of 2025, aims to extend the mine's life to 2049 and increase copper production capacity. This expansion is part of broader efforts to boost copper output amid tightening supply conditions.

title: Tivan Ltd News Today, Nov 14: Gold and Copper Discoveries Boost Timor
summary: Tivan Ltd announced significant gold and copper discoveries in Timor-Leste, marking an important development for the region's mining sector. These discoveries could enhance future copper production potential in the area.

title: AI boom pushes copper toward a supply crunch, BNEF warns
summary: A BloombergNEF report warns that AI data center construction is increasing copper demand by approximately 400,000 tonnes annually, with prices potentially reaching $13,500 per tonne by 2028. The surge in demand from AI infrastructure, combined with energy transition projects and fragile mine supply, is creating significant pressure on the copper market.

title: $25.3M ARENA boost to scale SunDrive's copper solar manufacturing tech
summary: The Australian Renewable Energy Agency has announced $25.3 million in funding for SunDrive to scale its copper solar cell technology to commercial production. The innovation replaces expensive silver with copper in solar cells, reducing costs and improving efficiency while supporting global decarbonization efforts.

title: BHP Resolution Copper Mine: 7 Innovations for 2025
summary: BHP and Rio Tinto are implementing seven key innovations at the Resolution Copper Project in Arizona, including automated drilling, advanced ore processing, and water recycling systems. These technologies aim to increase copper output by up to 100,000 tonnes annually while reducing carbon emissions by approximately 8% and improving operational efficiency by 30%.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices fell sharply on November 14 as concerns over the US Fed's hawkish stance triggered cautious market sentiment
summary: On November 14, the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaged 119,600 yuan/mt, down 1,050 yuan/mt from the previous day. The decline was driven by market caution due to the US Federal Reserve's hawkish stance and uncertainty from divergent Fed officials' views on interest rates, pressuring nickel prices to remain weak in the near term.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November Period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association announced benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of November 2025, with the reference price set at $15,075.33/wmt, down 0.44% from late October. Prices for various nickel grades also saw slight decreases compared to the previous period.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices were volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized in Q3 amid ongoing oversupply concerns driven mainly by rapid production growth in Indonesia. Despite rising consumption, structural oversupply pressured prices, with a forecast of temporary price support due to seasonal output declines in the Philippines from October to early 2026.

title: LME nickel holds steady as U.S. government shutdown ends amid persistent market caution
summary: LME nickel prices remained steady following the end of the U.S. government shutdown, but market caution persists amid uncertain economic conditions. The cautious sentiment continues to influence nickel trading dynamics.

title: FNI income triples to P1.5B as prices climb
summary: Filipino Nickel Industry (FNI) reported a tripling of income to P1.5 billion, driven by a 16.6% revenue increase due to higher average realized nickel ore prices amid strong demand and tight supply conditions.

title: 'Green' energy transition leaves a dirty trail in the Philippines' nickel belt
summary: Nickel mining in the southern Philippines is causing environmental damage and harming local communities' health and livelihoods. The region's nickel production is concentrated in the Dinagat Islands and Surigao del Sur, with most nickel ore exported to China due to limited local processing capacity. Refined nickel-cobalt sulfide is sent to Japan for further processing into battery-grade nickel used by companies like Panasonic and Toyota.

title: Indonesia limits new nickel permits to add value to production
summary: Indonesia, the world's largest nickel producer, has stopped approving new permits for nickel plants producing certain intermediate products without plans for further processing. This move aims to push the industry up the value chain and address oversupply, potentially causing delays or cancellations of new projects. The regulation affects plants finishing after 2027 and emphasizes investment in downstream processing for electric vehicle battery materials.

title: Fathom Nickel expands Gochager Lake footprint
summary: Fathom Nickel is advancing exploration at its Gochager Lake Project in Saskatchewan, Canada, aiming to establish a significant nickel district. Recent soil geochemistry and portable x-ray fluorescence results indicate expanding scale, with further assay results expected soon. Winter conditions favor upcoming drilling activities supported by infrastructure development like ice roads.

title: Homeland Nickel Enters Agreement with USA Company, Amplifying Exposure to Strategic Holdings
summary: Homeland Nickel Inc. announced the formation of Patriot Nickel Corp, a U.S.-based company aimed at building domestic nickel supply in Southern Oregon. Homeland will option key nickel properties to Patriot and receive a 20% equity stake, enhancing shareholder value and aligning with the 'America First' trend in critical mineral supply. The partnership is expected to facilitate regulatory progress and investor interest in the U.S. nickel sector.

title: On November 14, the price range for SMM #1 refined nickel was
summary: The price range for SMM #1 refined nickel on November 14, 2025, was between 117,400 and 121,800 yuan per metric ton, averaging 119,600 yuan/mt, marking a decrease of 1,050 yuan/mt. This reflects current market pricing trends for refined nickel in China.

title: Recycling technology achieves 99% purity of nickel and cobalt
summary: A research team from UNIST has developed an innovative electrochemical recycling technology that recovers over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with 99% purity. The breakthrough method uses a multifunctional special solvent and selective electrochemical separation, minimizing chemical usage and wastewater production while enabling efficient metal recovery in a single environmentally friendly step.

title: New EV battery recycling process recovers 99% pure nickel and cobalt
summary: Researchers have developed an eco-friendly recycling technology that extracts 99 percent pure nickel and cobalt from waste batteries. This advancement represents a significant breakthrough in sustainable battery recycling for the electric vehicle industry.

title: Canada's Nickel Processing Innovation for Clean Energy
summary: Canadian nickel processing facilities are implementing advanced sustainability innovations including renewable energy integration, closed-loop water systems achieving 85-95% reuse rates, and carbon sequestration technologies. These comprehensive environmental frameworks support net-zero emission processing and circular economy integration through multi-metal recovery and tailings repurposing.

title: Italy's Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris reported a 2% increase in third-quarter net sales to $2.98 billion, driven by stable drilling activity in the US and Canada, offsetting weakness in other regions. The company warned that margins will be affected by the full impact of tariff costs, with EU steel producers operating at reduced capacity due to rising imports and tariffs.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris reported stable sales of tubular products and services in Q3 2025, supported by steady activity in the US and Canada and some early shipments in the Middle East. Margins held up but have yet to fully reflect recent tariff increases. The company expects Q4 sales to remain close to Q3 levels but anticipates cost and margin pressures from tariffs.

title: Tenaris Launches $600M Second Tranche Under $1.2B Buyback
summary: Tenaris commenced the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, with $600 million allocated for purchases between November 3, 2025, and April 30, 2026. Shares bought back will be cancelled. The buyback is authorized by shareholders and complies with EU market abuse regulations.

title: Tenaris Announces Second Tranche of USD 600 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris announced the initiation of the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, with a non-discretionary agreement to purchase up to $600 million of shares from November 3, 2025, to April 30, 2026. The shares will be cancelled, and the program is authorized by the May 2025 shareholder meeting. The company highlighted risks related to oil and gas price fluctuations.

title: Tenaris discusses maximizing hydrogen storage vessel lifecycle in Tech Talk
summary: Tenaris released a Tech Talk video discussing the design, maintenance, and long-term performance of steel vessels for hydrogen storage. The video covers factors like fatigue, hydrogen embrittlement, and inspection cycles, emphasizing how Tenaris's proprietary THera® technology supports durable and scalable hydrogen storage solutions.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
summary: The Italian Antitrust Authority has launched an investigation into major low voltage copper cable manufacturers in Italy, including Prysmian, for alleged price fixing since 2005. Inspections were conducted at company offices and distributors, impacting Prysmian's stock price negatively, though analysts believe the investigation will have negligible impact on Prysmian's overall revenues.

title: Italian Expertise Fuels Prysmian Innovation
summary: Prysmian is advancing its R&D activities in Italy with over €5.5 million funding from Italian authorities for projects focused on high-voltage terrestrial and submarine transmission systems and renewable energy integration. The company is also involved in national initiatives like the Green New Deal and the RESTART Extended Partnership to drive innovation in energy and telecommunications.

title: BofA Sees Growth Potential for Prysmian from US Tariffs
summary: Bank of America projects that US copper tariffs could benefit Prysmian significantly, potentially increasing 2026 EBITDA by up to EUR1 billion due to Prysmian's US-based copper cable production and local sourcing. The tariffs may allow Prysmian to raise copper cable prices by 10%, with positive effects especially in medium- and low-voltage segments.

title: World's Top Cable Maker Sees US Copper Tariff as Opportunity
date: No specific date in past 24 hours, recent
summary: Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable maker, views the US copper tariff as an opportunity to strengthen its local supply chain and competitive position. The company benefits from sourcing copper domestically and is in close contact with US authorities regarding the tariff implementation.
